snippet: Grading instructions with sample answers suggest that the bar to pass the New York State English Regents exam is surprisingly low.
abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column; grading guidelines for the New York State English Regents exam appear to lower the bar significantly from past years; education officials say standards account for differences in student abilities: if the standard is set too high, too many students will fail, but if the standard is set too low, the resulting diploma is meaningless.
lead_paragraph: Grading instructions with sample answers suggest that the bar to pass the New York State English Regents exam is surprisingly low.

headline.seo: Despite Focus on Data, Standards for Diploma May Still Lack Rigor
headline.main: Despite Focus on Data, Standards for Diploma May Still Lack Rigor
headline.print_headline: Despite Emphasis on Testing, Standards to Get Diploma May Still Lack Rigor
